sources.data_found: Atlas GPU nodes: 4 GPU(V100) nodes with 2x V100 each (8 total V100); 5 GPU(A100) nodes with 8x A100 (80GB) each (40 total A100 80GB); 12 GPU(L40S) nodes with 4x L40S (48GB) each (48 total L40S).
Ptolemy: 8 compute nodes with 8x NVIDIA A100 (80GB) each (64 total A100 80GB) plus 2 development nodes with 1x NVIDIA A100 (80GB) each (2 more) => 66 total A100 80GB.
Morrill: CPU/GPU cluster with 104 nodes, including 32 GPUs (GPU model not specified). Ptolemy referenced as a 64 GPU Linux cluster.

student_data.notes: Fall 2024 Enrollment Fact Book (Mississippi Institutions of Higher Learning). On-campus Undergraduate Headcount Enrollment by Program Category: for Mississippi State University, the line 'Computer and Information Sciences and Support Services (CIP 11)' shows 569. The same PDF also lists an on-campus graduate headcount for CIP 11 at MSU as 173, but it does NOT break graduate enrollment into MS/Masters vs PhD, so grad_cs_count and phd_cs_count are set to 0 to avoid misclassification.

gpu_resources.notes: Atlas (HPC2): V100 = 4 nodes × 2 GPUs/node = 8 V100; A100-80GB = 5 nodes × 8 GPUs/node = 40 A100 80GB; L40S = 12 nodes × 4 GPUs/node = 48 L40S. Ptolemy (ARC): A100-80GB = (8 GPU compute nodes × 8 GPUs/node = 64) + (2 devel nodes × 1 GPU/node = 2) => 66 A100 80GB. Morrill (MSU Research Computing Services): 32 GPUs total mentioned, model not stated; estimated as A100-class (newer system, installed ~2024 per 2025-09-05 article) and counted here as A100 40GB (32). Totals: A100 80GB = 40 + 66 = 106; A100 40GB = 32; V100 = 8; L40S = 48.

analysis_notes: Data collected via multi-query approach: separate student and GPU searches.
